qas.question: Who was it that in 1063 gave rule over Galicia to his son?
What was the name of this son?
Who was the brother who later took control for himself?
Galicia then became part of which Kingdom?
Who standardized Castillan and made it the government's official language?

context: In 1063, <a0_0>Ferdinand I<a0_0/> of Castile divided his realm among his sons, and the Kingdom of Galicia was granted to <a1_0>Garcia II<a1_0/> of Galicia. In 1072, it was forcibly annexed by Garcia's brother <a2_0>Alfonso VI<a2_0/> of León; from that time Galicia was united with the <a3_0>Kingdom of León<a3_0/> under the same monarchs. In the 13th century <a4_0>Alfonso X<a4_0/> of Castile standardized the Castilian language and made it the language of court and government. Nevertheless, in his Kingdom of Galicia the Galician language was the only language spoken, and the most used in government and legal uses, as well as in literature.
